clickNewHostToStart: Click "New Host" button above to add your first server connection
continueAddingDuplicate: Do you want to continue adding this duplicate server?
switchDarkLight: Switch between dark and light mode
backupDescription: Create encrypted backups of your servers, tags, and settings. Backups are protected with AES-256 encryption.
cfApiTokenDesc: Enter your Cloudflare API Token with DNS:Edit permissions to manage DNS records.
dbSelectTableToView: Select a table to view its data
dbWriteQuery: Write a query and press Execute
dbSelectTableForStructure: Select a table to view its structure
dbConfirmDeleteColumn: Are you sure you want to delete this column? This action cannot be undone.
dbConfirmDeleteRow: Are you sure you want to delete this row?
erdHelp: Drag tables to move ‚Ä¢ Scroll to zoom ‚Ä¢ Double-click to view structure
erdSelectDatabase: Select a database to view ERD
dbImportExportDesc: Import SQL files or export your database to SQL format
dbDropAllTablesDesc: Warning: This will delete all data in existing tables
dbIncludeDropTableDesc: Add DROP TABLE IF EXISTS before CREATE
dbIncludeDataDesc: Export INSERT statements for all rows
dbExportInfo: The exported SQL file can be imported into any MySQL-compatible database
dbSmartDropDesc: Only drops tables found in import file, not all tables
confirmDelete: Are you sure you want to delete?
confirmDisconnect: Are you sure you want to disconnect?
githubBackupDesc: Sync encrypted backup to a private GitHub repository for cloud storage with version history.
apiTokenDesc: To manage your DNS records, you need to set up a Cloudflare API Token with DNS:Edit permissions.
name: Name
toolARecordDesc: DNS A record IP address for hostname
toolTXTRecordDesc: Check TXT records on a domain
toolSPFCheckDesc: Check SPF records on a domain
toolCNAMELookupDesc: DNS canonical name to IP address
sourceInstallerDesc: Install frameworks and CMS directly via SSH
sourceCouldNotFetchVersions: Could not fetch versions. Will use latest.
sourcePHPNotDetected: PHP not detected or not installed
sourceDepsCheckDesc: Checking required tools on the server...
sourceWaitSetup: Please wait while we set up your project...
sourceSelectFrameworkHint: Select a framework or CMS to install
wssTypeMessage: Type a message... (Enter to send, Shift+Enter for newline)
rdpSessionDesc: The RDP session is running in a separate window. Use that window to interact with the remote desktop.
rdpSessionClosedDesc: The remote desktop session has been closed.
rdpFailedConnect: Failed to connect to remote desktop
rdpPackagesRequired: The following packages are required for RDP connections:
rdpStep1: Click "Open Terminal" to launch a local terminal
rdpStep2: The command will be automatically pasted
rdpStep3: Press Enter and type your password when prompted
rdpReadyToConnect: You're ready to connect to RDP servers!
rdpErrorUnableConnect: Unable to connect to remote server. Please check:
rdpErrorCheckAddress: Server address and port are correct
rdpErrorAuthFailed: Authentication failed. Please check your username and password.
rdpErrorNegoFailed: Connection negotiation failed. The server may not support the required security protocols.
rdpErrorTimeout: Connection timed out. Server is not responding.
rdpErrorDns: Could not resolve server hostname. Please check the address.
rdpErrorCertificate: TLS/Certificate error. Try connecting again or check server configuration.
rdpErrorClosed: Connection was closed by the server.
rdpErrorGeneric: Connection failed. Please verify server settings and try again.
clickToSelectPort: Click to quickly select a common port
searchHostnameIpFingerprint: Search by hostname, IP address, or fingerprint...
confirmRemoveHost: Are you sure you want to remove {host} from known hosts?
importHostDesc: Import SSH fingerprint from a host
newHostMessage: The authenticity of this host cannot be established. This is the first time you're connecting to this server.
hostKeyChangedWarning: WARNING: The server's host key has changed! This could indicate a man-in-the-middle attack or the server has been reinstalled.
couldNotVerify: Could not verify the host fingerprint. The server may be unreachable or not running SSH.
selectKeyToUse: Select an SSH key to use
generateOrImportKey: Generate or import an SSH key to get started
copyPublicKeyToServer: Copy the public key and add it to ~/.ssh/authorized_keys on the server
keyIsProtectedWithPassphrase: This key is protected with a passphrase
selectKeyToViewDetails: Select a key to view details
pleaseEnterKeyNameAndPrivateKey: Please enter key name and private key
confirmDeleteKey: Are you sure you want to delete the key '{name}'?
proxyCheckDesc: Test HTTP, SOCKS4, SOCKS5 proxy connectivity
portListenerDesc: Scan and list all listening ports on this machine
smtpTestDesc: Test SMTP server connectivity with authentication
clickScanToStart: Click 'Scan Ports' to list all listening ports
enableCdnSecurity: Enable Cloudflare's CDN and security features
subject: Subject
connectToServerToAddKnownHosts: Connect to a server to add it to known hosts
tokenSavedEncrypted: API token is saved and encrypted
noIpFound: No IP address found for this hostname
author: Author
totpDescription: Generate TOTP codes for two-factor authentication
addTotpEntry: Add your first TOTP secret key to get started
onePerLine: one per line, format: name:secret or just secret
totpSecurityInfo: Your TOTP secrets are stored locally in your browser and are never sent to any server. Codes refresh every 30 seconds.
hotkeyDescription: Create keyboard shortcuts to quickly execute commands in SSH terminal
commandHint: The command will be typed and executed automatically
pleaseEnterKeyAndCommand: Please enter both key and command
hotkeyMustBeSingleChar: Hotkey must be a single character
hotkeyReserved: This key is reserved for system function
confirmDeleteHotkey: Are you sure you want to delete this hotkey?
clickAddHotkey: Click "Add Hotkey" to create your first custom shortcut
hotkeyUsage2: in SSH terminal to execute the command
hotkeyTip1: Hotkeys only work when focused in SSH terminal
hotkeyTip2: Commands are sent as-is (with Enter key at the end)
hotkeyTip3: Use hotkeys for frequently used commands like "ls -la", "docker ps", etc.
snippetsDescription: Command snippets with optional keyboard shortcuts for SSH sessions
snippetNameHint: A short descriptive name for this snippet
snippetCommandHint: The command to insert when clicked or triggered via hotkey
clickAddSnippet: Click "Add Snippet" to create your first command snippet
snippetUsageTip1: Click a snippet in the panel to insert it into the terminal
snippetUsageTip2: Commands are NOT auto-executed - press Enter to run
snippetUsageTip3: Use hotkeys for frequently used commands (optional)
snippetClickToInsert: Click to insert this command into terminal
confirmDeleteSnippet: Are you sure you want to delete this snippet?
snippetAddFromMenu: Add snippets from the Snippets menu
snippetClickHint: Click to insert ‚Ä¢ Press Enter to run
portForwardingDescription: SSH tunnel port forwarding (Local, Remote, Dynamic SOCKS)
addPortForwardDesc: Create SSH tunnels to securely forward ports
localForwardDesc: Local Forward: Access remote services through local port. E.g., connect to remote MySQL at 127.0.0.1:3306
remoteForwardDesc: Remote Forward: Expose local service to remote server. E.g., let remote server access your local web app
dynamicForwardDesc: Dynamic SOCKS: Create a SOCKS5 proxy through SSH. Route traffic through the SSH server
localForwardHelp: Forward local port to remote destination through SSH server
remoteForwardHelp: Forward remote port on SSH server to local destination
dynamicForwardHelp: Create SOCKS5 proxy for dynamic port forwarding
stopBeforeEdit: Please stop the forward before editing
changelogDesc: All notable changes to Marix SSH Client
gitlabAuthPrompt: GitLab will open in your browser. Please authorize Marix to access your account.
gitlabSecurityWarning: ‚ö†Ô∏è GitLab only stores encrypted data. We cannot recover your password or your backup.
gitlabPasswordWarning: Enter your backup password. If the password is incorrect, the data cannot be recovered.
boxAuthPrompt: Box.net will open in your browser. Please authorize Marix to access your account.
boxSecurityWarning: Your backup is encrypted end-to-end before uploading to Box.net. We never see your data or password.
boxPasswordWarning: Enter your backup password. If the password is incorrect, the data cannot be recovered.
onedriveAuthPrompt: Microsoft will open in your browser. Please authorize Marix to access your OneDrive.
onedriveSecurityWarning: Your backup is encrypted end-to-end before uploading to OneDrive. We never see your data or password.
onedrivePasswordWarning: Enter your backup password. If the password is incorrect, the data cannot be recovered.
gdriveAuthPrompt: Click "Connect to Google Drive" to authenticate. A browser window will open for you to sign in with your Google account.
gdriveSecurityWarning: Your backup is encrypted end-to-end before uploading to Google Drive. We never see your data or password.
gdriveRestoreWarning: This will replace all current servers with data from Google Drive backup.
oauthSuccessMessage: You can close this window and return to Marix.
localSecurityWarning: Keep your backup file and password secure. We cannot recover them if lost.
githubSecurityWarning: GitHub only stores encrypted data. We cannot recover your password or your backup.
envVarsDesc: Set environment variables for SSH session (KEY=value, one per line)
portKnockingDesc: Hide SSH port until knock sequence is sent
knockSetupDesc: Install and configure knockd daemon on your server.
envVarsDesc: Set environment variables on the remote shell (like ssh -o SetEnv)
knockStealthDesc: SSH port invisible to port scanners
knockBrutePreventionDesc: Can't attack what you can't see
knockDropOtherSSH: Drop all other SSH connections (will be opened by knockd)
knockTestDesc: Configure your server in Marix with port knocking enabled, enter the knock sequence, and connect to test.
knockRandomPortsDesc: Avoid common service ports. Use 7000-9999 range and generate random sequences in Marix.
knockLongSequencesDesc: More ports = harder to brute force. Use 4-6 ports for better security.
knockSetTimeoutDesc: Must knock all ports within timeout (e.g., 10 seconds).
knockUseSSHKeysDesc: Port knocking + SSH keys = defense in depth. Disable password authentication.
knockWarning1: Test before locking yourself out - keep a backup terminal session open
knockWarning2: Whitelist your current IP before blocking SSH port
knockWarning3: Have console access (VPS panel) in case of lockout
knockWarning4: Document your knock sequence in a password manager
knockMarixStep4: Generate Random: Click 'Random' button for secure sequence
knockMarixAutomatic: Marix will automatically knock before establishing SSH connection!
lanShareSecurity: Passwords and private keys will not be shared for security
pairingCodeDesc: Share this 6-digit code with the recipient device
noDevicesFound: No devices found on network. Make sure both devices are on the same network.
enterCodeToFind: Enter the 6-digit code shown on sender's screen
transferDirectly: Transfer files directly to devices on your local network
noSenderFound: No sender found with this code. Make sure the sender is waiting and both devices are on the same network.
closeConnectionsConfirm: Do you want to close all connections and exit?
serverAlreadyConnectedMessage: This server is already connected. Switching to existing session.
noNotesYet: No notes yet. Click to add notes for this server.
notePlaceholder: Write your notes here... (e.g., tasks to complete, configuration reminders)
shareCodeWithReceiver: Share this code with the receiver to verify the transfer
makeSureLANEnabled: Make sure LAN Discovery is enabled to receive files
pleaseSelectDeviceFilesCode: Please select a device, files, and enter pairing code
failedToAcceptWrongCode: Failed to accept transfer - wrong code?
shareCodeWithReceiverDesc: Share this code with the receiver. They will enter it to connect.
tellReceiverCode: Tell the receiver to enter code
askSenderForCode: Ask the sender for their 6-digit pairing code
receiveStep1: Ask the sender to prepare their files and click "Prepare to Send"
receiveStep2: Enter the 6-digit pairing code they give you
receiveStep3: Click "Find Sender" - the app will automatically find them on your network
receiveStep4: Once found, click "Receive Files" and choose where to save
searchingOnNetwork: Searching for sender on local network...
noSenderFoundWithCode: No sender found with this code. Make sure the sender is waiting and both devices are on the same network.
pleaseSearchFindSenderFirst: Please search and find a sender first
sessionMonitorDesc: Monitor SSH connection latency and health in real-time
commandRecallDesc: Remember commands per server (Tab to recall). Stored locally, never synced.
commandRecallSecurityNote: Commands containing passwords, tokens, or secrets are automatically filtered out for security.
commandRecallEmptyHint: Commands you run will appear here
appLockDesc: Lock app after inactivity to protect your connections
appLockPasswordRequirement: Password must be at least 4 characters
appLockInfoDesc: Lock app after inactivity with PIN (4 digits), password, or blur screen. Configure timeout in Settings.
benchmarkDescription: This will test system information, disk speed, and network performance on the remote server.
